metadata.titleEn: Dataset of Heihe integrated observatory network: automatic weather station of mixed forest station, 2022
metadata.titleCn: 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网：混合林站自动气象站（2022）
metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Heihe integrated observatory network obtained from the automatic weather station (AWS) at the Sidaoqiao mixed forest station from January 1 to December 31, 2022. The site (101.134° E, 41.990° N) was located on a tamarix and populous forest (Tamarix chinensis Lour. and Populus euphratica Olivier.) surface in the Sidaoqiao, Dalaihubu Town, Ejin Banner, Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. The elevation is 874 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (28 m, north), wind speed and direction profile (28 m, north), air pressure (in tamper box), rain gauge (28 m, south), four-component radiometer (24 m, south), two infrared temperature sensors (24 m, south, vertically downward), two photosynthetically active radiation (24 m, south, one vertically upward and one vertically downward), soil heat flux (HFP01; 3 duplicates, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (0, -0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.6, -1.0, -1.6, -2.0, -2.4 m), and soil moisture profile (-0.02, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.6, -1.0, -1.6, -2.0, -2.4 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_28 m; RH_28 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_28 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_28 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), photosynthetically active radiation of upward and downward (PAR_up and PAR_down) (μmol/ (s m^2)), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2 and Gs_3) (W/m^2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_2 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_60 cm, Ts_100, Ts_160, Ts_200, Ts_240 cm) (℃), and soil moisture (Ms_2 cm, Ms_4 cm, Ms_10 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_60 cm, Ms_100, Ms_160, Ms_200, Ms_240 cm) (%, volumetric water content).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2022-9-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2022年1月1日至2022年12月31日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网下游混合林站气象要素观测数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗达来呼布镇四道桥，下垫面是胡杨与柽柳。观测点的经纬度是101.1335E,41.9903N，海拔874m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在28m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在28m处；风速与风向传感器架设在28m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在24m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在24m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；两个光合有效辐射仪安装在24m处，朝向正南，探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm、100cm、160cm、200cm和240cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下2cm、4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、60cm、100cm、160cm、200cm和240cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_28m、RH_28m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_28m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_28m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_60cm、Ts_100cm、Ts_160cm、Ts_200cm、Ts_240cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_60cm、Ms_100cm、Ms_160cm、Ms_200cm、Ms_240cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、向上与向下光合有效辐射（PAR_up、PAR_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2022-6-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称
黑河综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了共11个地表通量和气象站，其中包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Verification.QuestionEn: Are there quality control procedures in place to handle missing or duplicate data in the meteorological dataset from the 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网?
Verification.QuestionCn: 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网的气象数据集是否有质量控制程序来处理缺失或重复数据？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What data collection methods are employed to measure energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis–desert systems?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，测量能量、水蒸气和碳通量所采用的数据收集方法有哪些？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: eddy covariance system, scintillometer, automatic weather stations
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统、闪烁仪、自动气象站

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Where are the meteorological stations located for studying the oasis–desert interactions in western China?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在中国西部研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用的气象站位于哪里？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What challenges do inland river basins in arid and semi-arid areas face that impact data collection efforts?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临哪些挑战，这些挑战影响数据收集工作？

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when collecting data in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Example.QuestionCn: 在收集绿洲–沙漠生态系统数据时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge faced when collecting data in oasis–desert ecosystems is the ecological environment degradation, which includes issues like the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, especially in inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas.
Example.AnswerCn: 在收集绿洲-沙漠生态系统数据时面临的一个挑战是生态环境退化，包括河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，尤其是在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset that includes both hydrometeorological data and vegetation parameters in arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个包含干旱地区水文气象数据和植被参数的示例数据集？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of such a dataset includes long-term observations of energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, acquired from automatic weather stations in the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin in western China.
Example.AnswerCn: 这样的数据集的一个例子包括对中国西部黑河流域中下游地区的自动气象站获取的能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量的长期观测，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the main characteristics and components of the meteorological data collected in arid and semi-arid regions, particularly in the context of oasis–desert systems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，特别是在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集的气象数据的主要特征和组成部分是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: air temperature, relative humidity, air pressure, precipitation, wind speed and direction, radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, soil moisture profiles, groundwater table data
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 空气温度、相对湿度、气压、降水、风速和风向、辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、土壤湿度剖面、地下水位数据

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What specific attributes of soil and vegetation are crucial for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的关键土壤和植被特征有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: soil temperature, soil moisture, soil heat flux, vegetation parameters
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 土壤温度、土壤湿度、土壤热通量、植被参数

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the frequency of data collection for meteorological elements in the observational dataset from the Heihe River Basin?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域的观测数据集中，气象要素的数据收集频率是多少？

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many soil temperature and moisture measurement depths are included in the automated weather station's data collection network?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自动气象站的数据采集网络中包含多少个土壤温度和湿度测量深度？

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'eddy covariance system' mean in the context of data collection methods for energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在能量、水汽和碳通量的数据收集方法中，“涡度协方差系统”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: An eddy covariance system is a data collection method that involves measuring half-hourly turbulent flux data, which is utilized to study long-term energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes in artificial and natural oasis–desert systems.
Definition.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统是一种数据收集方法，涉及测量半小时的湍流通量数据，用于研究人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统中的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'automatic weather stations' in the context of hydrometeorological data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在水文气象数据收集的背景下，“自动气象站”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: Automatic weather stations refer to data collection setups that measure various hydrometeorological parameters such as radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles, typically averaged over a 10-minute period.
Definition.AnswerCn: 自动气象站是指一种数据收集装置，用于测量各种水文气象参数，如辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面，通常以10分钟为单位进行平均。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do data collection methods for soil temperature and soil moisture in the 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网 compare to those used in the oasis–desert systems datasets?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网的土壤温度和土壤湿度数据收集方法与绿洲-沙漠系统数据集中的方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In the 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网, soil temperature and soil moisture are measured using sensors buried at various depths from 0 cm to 240 cm, with data collected every 10 minutes. In contrast, the oasis–desert systems datasets also involve soil temperature profiles and soil moisture, but details of the collection method, such as specific depths or frequency of measurements, are not explicitly mentioned. Both systems employ automatic weather stations for data collection.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在黑河流域地表过程综合观测网中，土壤温度和土壤湿度通过埋设在0厘米到240厘米不同深度的传感器进行测量，数据每10分钟收集一次。相比之下，绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集也涉及土壤温度剖面和土壤湿度，但没有明确提及具体的测量深度或频率。两个系统都使用自动气象站进行数据收集。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in data processing and quality control measures between the 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网 and the oasis–desert systems datasets?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网与绿洲-沙漠系统数据集在数据处理和质量控制措施方面有哪些差异？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网 involves quality control measures such as marking missing data with -6999, removing duplicates, and deleting data outside physical or instrument limits. The oasis–desert systems datasets also include data processing and quality control but emphasize a structured process involving data collection, processing, archiving, and sharing, without specifying the exact measures like marking or removal of data.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 黑河流域地表过程综合观测网涉及质量控制措施，例如用-6999标记缺失数据、删除重复数据以及删除超出物理或仪器限制的数据。绿洲-沙漠系统数据集也包括数据处理和质量控制，但强调一个结构化的过程，包括数据收集、处理、归档和共享，而没有具体说明标记或删除数据的确切措施。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can long-term observational datasets contribute to the sustainable development and ecological security of oasis-desert systems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集可以通过哪些方式促进绿洲-沙漠系统的可持续发展和生态安全？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets can contribute to sustainable development and ecological security of oasis-desert systems by providing essential data for understanding the dynamics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, helping to inform strategies for balancing oasis and desert systems, and supporting efforts towards carbon neutrality and ecological conservation.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集可以通过提供能量、水汽和碳交换动态的基本数据，为绿洲-沙漠系统的可持续发展和生态安全做出贡献，帮助制定平衡绿洲和沙漠系统的策略，并支持实现碳中和和生态保护的努力。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes challenges in maintaining data quality and accuracy in datasets collected from oasis–desert systems in arid and semiarid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠系统中收集的数据集维护数据质量和准确性面临的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining data quality and accuracy in datasets from oasis–desert systems can arise from ecological environment degradation such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, especially in inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在来自绿洲-沙漠系统的数据集中，维护数据质量和准确性面临的挑战可能源于生态环境的退化，例如河流和湖泊的干涸、自然植被的退化、土地沙漠化的加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，尤其是在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it essential to use a combination of both artificial and natural observational data collection methods in studying oasis–desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在研究绿洲-沙漠系统时，结合使用人工和自然观测数据收集方法是必不可少的？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Using a combination of both artificial and natural observational data collection methods is essential to capture a comprehensive suite of long-term data involving energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes, as well as auxiliary hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, which are crucial for understanding oasis–desert interactions and ensuring ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 使用人工和自然观测数据收集方法的结合，对于捕捉涉及能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的长期数据，以及辅助的水文气象、植被和土壤参数至关重要，这些数据对于理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及确保生态稳定和社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What underlying factors make continuous long-term observations necessary for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 哪些潜在因素使得对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的持续长期观测变得必要？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Continuous long-term observations are necessary due to the need for a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, which is critical to maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems, achieving carbon peaking and carbon neutrality goals, and supporting sustainable development and ecological security in these regions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 由于需要定量了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换，持续的长期观测是必要的，这对于维持绿洲和沙漠系统之间的平衡、实现碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持这些地区的可持续发展和生态安全至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What outcomes might arise from implementing a long-term observational dataset in oasis–desert ecosystems focusing on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 实施一个长期观测数据集在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，重点关注能量、水蒸气和碳交换，可能会产生哪些结果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing a long-term observational dataset in oasis–desert ecosystems can provide a quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions. This knowledge is significant for protecting ecological stability and promoting socioeconomic development of oases, contributing to achieving carbon peaking and carbon neutrality goals.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中实施长期观测数据集可以定量理解能量、水汽和碳的交换，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要。这些知识对于保护生态稳定性和促进绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义，有助于实现碳达峰和碳中和目标。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the establishment of multiple land surface flux and meteorological stations impact the understanding of hydrometeorological processes in the middle and lower reaches of river basins in arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 多个地表通量和气象站的建立将如何影响对干旱地区河流流域中下游水文气象过程的理解？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The establishment of multiple land surface flux and meteorological stations can enhance the understanding of hydrometeorological processes by providing comprehensive data on energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes. It supports the study of oasis–desert interactions, aiding in the protection of ecological stability and contributing to the sustainable development of these regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 建立多个地表通量和气象站可以增强对水文气象过程的理解，通过提供关于能量、水汽和碳通量的综合数据。这支持对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的研究，有助于保护生态稳定性，并为这些地区的可持续发展做出贡献。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the fundamental goals behind collecting comprehensive meteorological and soil data in the Heihe River Basin's mixed forest station?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域混合森林站收集全面的气象和土壤数据的基本目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The fundamental goals are to understand the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, which is crucial for achieving sustainable development, supporting ecological security, and maintaining the carbon balance in arid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 基本目标是了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，这对于实现可持续发展、支持生态安全和维持干旱地区的碳平衡至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to maintain long-term observational datasets in arid and semi-arid oasis–desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱的绿洲-沙漠系统中，维护长期观测数据集的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets are important to quantitatively understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, which is significant for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and protecting the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集对于定量理解绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换至关重要，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the steps involved in setting up and maintaining an automatic weather station for collecting meteorological data in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区建立和维护自动气象站以收集气象数据的步骤有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data collection involves setting up sensors at various heights and orientations for measuring air temperature, relative humidity, wind speed, and direction, among other parameters. The automatic weather station should be equipped with sensors installed at specific heights, such as 28m for air temperature and wind sensors, and 24m for radiation instruments. Soil temperature and moisture sensors are embedded at different depths, and data is collected every 10 minutes. Quality control includes ensuring data completeness, removing duplicates, and filtering out physically unrealistic values.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据收集涉及在不同高度和方向设置传感器，以测量空气温度、相对湿度、风速和风向等参数。自动气象站应配备安装在特定高度的传感器，例如28米处用于空气温度和风传感器，24米处用于辐射仪器。土壤温度和湿度传感器嵌入在不同深度，数据每10分钟收集一次。质量控制包括确保数据完整性、去除重复数据和过滤不合理的物理值。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can data from multiple meteorological stations be effectively processed and quality controlled for research on oasis–desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何有效处理和质量控制来自多个气象站的数据，以便对绿洲-沙漠生态系统进行研究？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Effective data processing and quality control involve ensuring a consistent format for date and time, marking missing data with a specific code (-6999), and removing duplicate entries or outliers that exceed instrument ranges. Data collection involves half-hourly turbulent flux data from eddy covariance systems and additional hydrometeorological data, with processing steps that include data archiving and sharing.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 有效的数据处理和质量控制涉及确保日期和时间的一致格式，用特定代码（-6999）标记缺失数据，以及删除超过仪器范围的重复条目或异常值。数据收集包括来自涡度协方差系统的半小时湍流通量数据和其他水文气象数据，处理步骤包括数据归档和共享。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural steps are necessary to ensure the reliability of soil moisture and temperature measurements in oasis–desert research?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保绿洲-沙漠研究中土壤湿度和温度测量可靠性的程序步骤有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To ensure reliability, soil temperature and moisture sensors are buried at multiple depths ranging from 0cm to 240cm, maintaining a consistent distance from the meteorological tower (2m south). Accurate data collection requires frequent measurements (every 10 minutes) and quality control measures, such as flagging questionable data and maintaining a uniform data format for easy analysis.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了确保可靠性，土壤温度和湿度传感器埋设在多个深度，范围从0厘米到240厘米，保持与气象塔的距离一致（南侧2米）。准确的数据收集需要频繁测量（每10分钟一次）和质量控制措施，例如标记可疑数据，并保持统一的数据格式以便于分析。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What data collection methods enable the comprehensive monitoring of meteorological and soil conditions in arid and semi-arid regions like the Heihe River Basin?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些数据收集方法能够全面监测像黑河流域这样的干旱和半干旱地区的气象和土壤条件？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Data collection methods in arid and semi-arid regions like the Heihe River Basin include the use of automatic weather stations that monitor variables such as air temperature, relative humidity, wind speed and direction, radiation, soil heat flux, and soil moisture. Additionally, the use of eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes are employed.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，如黑河流域，数据收集方法包括使用自动气象站监测空气温度、相对湿度、风速和风向、辐射、土壤热通量和土壤湿度等变量。此外，还使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪来测量能量、水蒸气和碳通量。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What are the challenges associated with ensuring data quality and consistency in long-term observational datasets from oasis–desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 确保来自绿洲-沙漠系统的长期观察数据集的数据质量和一致性面临哪些挑战？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Challenges associated with ensuring data quality and consistency in long-term observational datasets include handling data gaps by marking them with specific indicators, removing duplicate records, eliminating data that exceed physical or instrumental limits, and marking questionable data for further review. Consistency is maintained through uniform data formatting and rigorous quality control procedures.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 确保长期观察数据集的数据质量和一致性面临的挑战包括通过特定指标标记数据缺口、删除重复记录、消除超过物理或仪器限制的数据，以及标记可疑数据以供进一步审查。一致性通过统一的数据格式和严格的质量控制程序得以维护。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might some expected patterns in energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems not be observed in datasets from arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区的数据集中，某些预期的能量、水蒸气和碳交换模式可能未被观察到的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing ecological environment degradation, such as drying rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These factors could disrupt expected patterns in energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的问题，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些因素可能会扰乱预期的能量、水汽和碳交换模式。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the challenges that could prevent the accurate collection of long-term observational data for oasis–desert systems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 可能会阻碍对绿洲-沙漠系统进行准确的长期观测数据收集的挑战有哪些？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges include the ecological environment degradation in arid regions, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, desertification, and dust storms, which may affect the stability and accuracy of long-term data collection efforts.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 挑战包括干旱地区生态环境的恶化，例如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、沙漠化和沙尘暴，这可能影响长期数据收集工作的稳定性和准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be discrepancies between anticipated and actual data collection outcomes from meteorological stations in arid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，气象站的预期数据收集结果与实际结果之间可能存在差异的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Discrepancies may arise due to harsh environmental conditions and ecological degradation in arid regions, which can affect the functionality of equipment and the reliability of data collected by meteorological stations.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 由于恶劣的环境条件和干旱地区的生态退化，可能会出现差异，这会影响设备的功能和气象站收集数据的可靠性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges and considerations when collecting data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集能量、水汽和碳交换数据的潜在挑战和注意事项是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological degradation challenges like drying rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, desertification, and dust storms. These challenges necessitate careful data collection to ensure accurate assessments of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态退化的挑战，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、沙漠化和沙尘暴。这些挑战需要仔细的数据收集，以确保对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的准确评估。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How can long-term observational datasets enhance our understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in arid and semiarid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集如何增强我们对干旱和半干旱地区能量、水蒸气和碳交换的理解？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets are crucial for obtaining a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, which is significant for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集对于获得绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解至关重要，这对认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及支持生态稳定和社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the advantages of using automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period for collecting hydrometeorological data in arid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区使用10分钟平均周期的自动气象站收集水文气象数据的优点有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period provide detailed and frequent data necessary for accurately observing hydrometeorological parameters, such as radiation, soil heat flux, temperature profiles, air pressure, and soil moisture, which are vital for comprehensive analyses in arid regions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期提供详细而频繁的数据，这些数据对于准确观察水文气象参数（如辐射、土壤热通量、温度剖面、气压和土壤湿度）至关重要，这些参数在干旱地区的综合分析中是必不可少的。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the data quality control techniques used for ensuring the reliability of meteorological data collected in oasis–desert areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 总结用于确保在绿洲-沙漠地区收集的气象数据可靠性的数据质量控制技术。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data quality control techniques include ensuring daily data completeness, removing duplicate records, deleting data that is physically implausible or beyond instrument range, marking questionable data in red, and standardizing the format for date and time.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据质量控制技术包括确保每日数据的完整性、删除重复记录、删除物理上不合理或超出仪器范围的数据、将可疑数据标记为红色，以及标准化日期和时间的格式。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in maintaining ecological stability in oasis–desert systems and suggest potential data collection methodologies to address these challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析在绿洲-沙漠系统中维持生态稳定性所面临的挑战，并建议潜在的数据收集方法来应对这些挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges include ecological degradation such as drying up of rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, desertification, and dust storms. Data collection methodologies could involve long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange using eddy covariance systems and automatic weather stations to understand and mitigate these challenges.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括生态退化，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、沙漠化和沙尘暴。数据收集方法可以包括使用涡度协方差系统和自动气象站进行长期观察，以了解和减轻这些挑战。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential datasets that could be integrated with hydrometeorological data to enhance the understanding of carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探索可以与水文气象数据集成的潜在数据集，以增强对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中碳交换的理解。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets include those covering energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, as well as vegetation and soil parameters. These datasets are available from observational stations established in the middle and lower reaches of arid regions, which provide comprehensive data necessary for understanding carbon exchange.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集包括涵盖能源、水汽和碳通量的内容，以及植被和土壤参数。这些数据集来自于在干旱地区中下游建立的观测站，提供了理解碳交换所需的全面数据。
